document_data.name: Seal
document_data.mainbody: '''Seals''' were arctic [[animal]]s common to the [[Great Glacier]] and [[Icewind Dale]].
document_data.Description: Seals of the Great Glacier had thick, brown-colored fur. They had powerful flippers. Seals had smallish heads with sharp teeth.
document_data.Behavior:
Seals could be observed chasing birds and fish, leaping from snow banks, and sunning on icebergs. They were thought of as playful, but could be ferocious when fighting.

A seal could hold its breath for a very long time and was a superb swimmer.
document_data.Combat: Seals were territorial and might defend their selected area of land with a dangerous bite.

Ecology.Diet: Seals were primarily known to feed small [[fish]], clams, and [[squid]]s.
Ecology.Usages: Seals were one of the primary game animals hunted by the [[Iulutiun]] people, providing them with food, fuel, and clothing.

document_data.Varieties:
Three unique species of seal lived on the Great Glacier:
* [[Scoop seal]]s, which had [[shovel]]-like flippers used for burrowing in snow,
* [[Chatter seal]]s, which mimicked voices, much like mockingbirds, and
* [[Fanged seal]]s, which had especially sharp teeth.
A number of seal species were also found in the [[Moonsea (lake)|Moonsea]].{{Cite web/Moonsea Fauna}}
*[[Rocky shore seal]]s, inhabitants of the rocky shores that were common in the eastern portions of the Moonsea.
*[[Sea bear]]s, large and aggressive predators, rarely found in the eastern Moonsea. Their population was dwindling around [[1371 DR]].
*[[River Lis seal]]s, nocturnal spotted seals that made eerie sounds, common in the [[River Lis]].
*[[Moonsea seal]]s, rarely hunted compared to other seals of the region, found throughout the entire Moonsea.
*[[Sea hag (seal)|Sea hags]], enormous herbivorous seals that were thought to have gone extinct by [[1341 DR]].
*[[Moonsea tusker]]s, enormous seals that fed on crustaceans, thought to have gone extinct before [[1071 DR]] due to overhunting.
document_data.Notable Seals: The [[human]] [[druid]] [[Mantiera]] spent much of her time in the shape of a seal.{{Cite card/AD&D Trading Cards/1992|572|Mantiera}}
